bigshot
Class Image

java.lang.Object
  bigshot.Image

public class Image
extends Object

A 30-bit (10 per channel) RGB image.

Constructor Summary

          Creates an empty (all-black) image with the given width and height.
Image(int width, int height, int[] data)
          Creates an image with the given data.

Method Detail

componentValue

public void componentValue(int x,
                           int y,
                           int[] result)
Gets the red, green and blue values for a given pixel.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
result - the array to put the result in. result[0] = red, result[1] = green, result[2] = blue

componentValue

public void componentValue(int x,
                           int y,
                           int r,
                           int g,
                           int b)
Sets the red, green and blue values for a given pixel.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
r - the red value
g - the green value
b - the blue value

value

public int value(int x,
                 int y)
Gets the packed pixel color value for a given pixel.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
Returns:
the packed, 30-bit-total, 10-bit-per-color, value

componentValue

protected int componentValue(int x,
                             int y,
                             int shift)
Helper function to get the component with a given bitshift from a pixel.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
shift - the bitshift of the component to return

lerp

protected double lerp(double a,
                      double b,
                      double x)
Helper function to linerarly interpolate between two values over the interval [0, 1].

Parameters:
a - the value at 0
b - the value at 1
x - the point in the interval [0, 1] that we want the value for
Returns:
the value at x

sample

protected int sample(double x,
                     double y,
                     int shift)
Samples a linearly interpolated channel value.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate to sample
y - the y-coordinate to sample
shift - the bitshift of the component
Returns:
the component value at x, y

sampleComponents

public void sampleComponents(double x,
                             double y,
                             int[] result)
Computes a linearly interpolated value for all channels at a given point

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate to sample
y - the y-coordinate to sample
result - the result of the interpolated sampling. result[0] = red, result[1] = green, result[2] = blue

sample

public int sample(double x,
                  double y)
Computes a packed 30-bit interpolated value for all channels at a given point

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate to sample
y - the y-coordinate to sample
Returns:
the 30-bit interpolated sample at the given point

value

                  int y,
                  int v)
Sets the packed 30-bit value at a given point

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
v - the 30-bit packed value to set the pixel to

multiply

public void multiply(int y0,
                     int y1,
                     int num,
                     int denom)
Scales all channels by num / denom.

Parameters:
y0 - the first line to apply the scaling to
y1 - one-past the last line to apply the scaling to
